alert.note: Alert for Haines Borough and Klukwan (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 25 at 10:54AM AKST until December 26 at 9:00AM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...STORM WILL BRING HEAVY SNOW TO THE HIGHWAYS... .Up to 12 inches of snow has been reported along the Klondike Highway this morning while the Haines Highway has seen mostly rain. Temperatures are over achieving with much stronger warm air advection associated with the storm than previously forecasted. Snow levels have risen up to between 1,000 ft to 1,500 ft. Temperatures are now expected to remain steady through the afternoon, but then cool this evening as cold air advects over the area. This will allow for some additional snow accumulation this evening. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM AKST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations between 6 to 8 inches. * WHERE...Haines Highway near Haines Customs. * WHEN...Until 9 AM AKST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...As the front exits the Panhandle, cold air is expected to advect over the border. This will allow for a short period of heavy snow. Heaviest snow is expected late this afternoon into this evening. If temperatures fail to cool, little snow accumulation will occur.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water with you in case of an emergency. People are urged to prepare their property before the onset of winter weather. For the latest road conditions, where available, call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
